title: module.apply() might fail  in some cases
body_html:
Won't this fail for cases where there are Sequential modules inside Sequential modules according to the behaviour of .children() as explained here.

If so, should I change it to self.modules() and open a PR?
body_text:
Won't this fail for cases where there are Sequential modules inside Sequential modules according to the behaviour of .children() as explained here.
If so, should I change it to self.modules() and open a PR?
body:
Won't [this](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/nn/modules/module.py#L163) fail for cases where there are Sequential modules inside Sequential modules according to the behaviour of `.children()` as explained [here](https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/module-children-vs-module-modules/4551/4).

If so, should I change it to `self.modules()` and open a PR?
